title: Jays silence Ohtani's 2-way show to even Series
content: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit a two-run homer off Shohei Ohtani, and the Blue Jays shook off their epic 18-inning loss to even the World Series with a 6-2 victory over the Dodgers in Game 4 on Tuesday night.

title: Patriots deal White to 49ers, Dugger to Steelers
content: The Patriots traded away two former defensive starters Tuesday night, sending defensive end Keion White to the 49ers and safety Kyle Dugger to the Steelers, sources told ESPN.

title: Heat's Rozier faced $8M tax lien from IRS in '23
content: Heat guard Terry Rozier, who was placed on leave amid allegations he manipulated his performance in a March 2023 NBA game as part of gambling schemes, was facing an $8 million tax lien from the IRS in November 2023.

title: Sources: WNBA offers extension on CBA deadline
content: The WNBA has offered players a 30-day extension to continue negotiations for a new CBA ahead of the October 31 deadline.

title: LSU interim living in moment despite 'dream' job
content: Interim LSU coach Frank Wilson called his promotion "something you would dream of" but eschewed the opportunity discuss his prospects for retaining the job beyond the rest of this season.

title: Dad: Aspinall 'can't see anything' out of right eye
content: The father of Tom Aspinall said the UFC heavyweight champion "can't see anything" out of his right eye days after the disastrous eye poke he suffered against Ciryl Gane at UFC 321.

title: Miller makes first Vancouver visit after 'ugly' end
content: Rangers captain J.T. Miller expects it to be emotional as he returns to Vancouver for the first time since the Canucks traded him last season after six seasons.

title: Police still looking for Shaq's stolen Range Rover
content: A $180,000 Range Rover customized for NBA legend Shaquille O'Neal was stolen in Georgia earlier this month, and law enforcement is still on the hunt for it.

title: 💪 Latest NFL Power Rankings
content: Let's update our NFL Power Rankings ahead of Week 9. Plus, we picked the best offseason signing, hiring or draft pick for each roster.

title: Solak: Why Drake Maye should be MVP, a defense of Caleb Williams, four trades that must happen
content: Here are four takes off the first eight weeks of the season, four trade proposals that make a ton of sense and some wild Week 8 trends to watch.

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in, who's out, who has work to do after Week 9
content: Does Notre Dame need to run the table? We try to make sense of the constantly evolving playoff picture conference by conference.

title: Carousel chaos meets Lane Kiffin, and what he does next will be interesting
content: More than $150M in buyouts and multiple job openings mean Lane Kiffin is the center of the CFB universe.

title: 200 plays on a wristband?! Why some NFL QBs wear play sheets on their wrists and others don't
content: Some QBs like the way wristbands speed up the process, but others, such as Dak Prescott, don't want to lose eye contact.

title: Why the Saints are turning to QB Tyler Shough now
content: After benching Spencer Rattler during their Week 8 loss, the Saints will start their second-round pick Sunday.

title: Five reasons Brian Kelly failed at LSU
content: Kelly's departure could be pinned on trouble with his staff, trouble fitting in or a mad scramble for Lane Kiffin.

title: NBA gambling scandal follows familiar Mafia playbook
content: Prosecutors say two former NBA players played in rigged poker games run by mob members. Organized crime has long exploited athletes' vulnerabilities.

title: Women's Bracketology: Ranking of No. 1 seeds shifts in final preseason edition
content: A key injury to South Carolina and other developments in the final weeks to tipoff shift projections.

title: 'A moment of glory': How the daughter of two Ohio State 'i dotters' fulfilled her destiny
content: Sydney Reeves grew up with two Ohio State sousaphone players for parents. She always knew what she had to do.

title: Arne Slot's biggest test yet as Liverpool head coach: Ending this mini-crisis
content: After the dizzying highs of a league title, Liverpool's slump this term under Arne Slot has become a crisis. Can the mercurial Dutch manager turn things around?

title: It might get worse for Juventus before it gets better
content: The problems plaguing Juventus, which led to the firing of coach Igor Tudor, have been years in the making.

title: Powerhouses Spain, Germany set up mouthwatering Nations League final
content: Reigning world champions Spain will take on perennial European powerhouse Germany to decide the winner of the UEFA Women's Nations League.

title: Agyemang injury worry, Lionesses return to form, Matildas outclassed
content: The Lionesses rediscovered their top gear but might have suffered a major blow, while the Matildas must flip the script in this burgeoning rivalry.

title: Trade value index: Trust in Drake Maye, Harold Fannin Jr.
content: With less than a month to the fantasy trade deadline, the rest-of-season rankings help identify worthy targets.

title: Experts' rankings for Week 9
content: Individual and composite rankings for each position in PPR and IDP formats, plus Eric Karabell's superflex ranks.

title: Wardley moves up at heavyweight after KO of Parker
content: Fabio Wardley is the new WBO interim heavyweight champion and moves up five spots. Here are the latest ESPN rankings in all weight classes.

title: LA Knight's loss, JD McDonagh's win both carry weight
content: When wins and losses matter in WWE, a thrilling women's tag team championship and more to remember from "Raw."

title: World Series Odds: Dodgers in control as MVP favorite Ohtani takes mound for Game 4
content: Odds for the Los Angeles Dodgers vs Toronto Blue Jays World Series including results, MVP and stat leaders.

title: College football futures: Is now the time to bet on Marcel Reed and Texas A&M?
content: As the odds shift for the Heisman Trophy and national title, Pamela Maldonado breaks down what to know.

title: Why all 16 playoff teams will (and won't) win MLS Cup
content: Look at the MLS playoff field long enough and you can make a case that all 16 teams have what it takes to be contenders -- or that they're pretenders.

title: Bearman's Mexico performance shows Ferrari there's life after Hamilton, Leclerc
content: It's been a season to forget at Ferrari, but academy driver Oliver Bearman is showing promise at Haas, culminating in a fourth-place finish in Mexico.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Vinícius Júnior eyes Real Madrid exit in January
content: Real Madrid forward Vinícius Júnior could seek an exit in the January transfer window. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Cyclone Montha landfall: Narsapuram coast heaves a sigh of relief, no loss of life
content: No deaths have been reported; 268 trees have collapsed, and eight houses were damaged along the Narsapuram coast

title: Masked shooters target Congress leader's office in Chhattisgarh; 2 kin injured
content: The incident took place at around 6 p.m. on Tuesday (October 28) in Masturi town when local Janpad vice-president Nitesh Singh of the Congress was in his office

title: Maharashtra cabinet approves vision document ‘Developed Maharashtra 2047’
content: According to the CMO, the statewide survey campaign was conducted under the Information and Public Relations Department to get the opinions, expectations, feedback, aspirations and priorities of the citizens on the “Developed Maharashtra-2047” plan.

title: The politics of the EBCs in Bihar
content: As Bihar gears up for the 2025 Assembly Elections, the marginalisation of Extremely Backward Castes in the political landscape is becoming increasingly apparent, highlighting the challenges they face in mobilising a coalition among their 112 recognised castes

title: Poll-bound Bihar ranks last in most social and economic indicators
content: In terms of the Human Development Index, Bihar ranked last among the 27 States which had relevant data in 2022

title: Bihar Assembly election LIVE: INDIA bloc manifesto vows measures for official language status to Bhojpuri, Magahi, Bajjika, Angika
content: "Initiatives will be taken to include the Bhojpuri, Magahi, Bajjika and Angika languages in the Eighth Schedule of the Constitution so that they can be accorded the status of official languages," the manifesto said.

title: Memories of the mid-1960s rice shortage in Tamil Nadu
content: The Hindu, in a news report on October 7, 1964, stated that “Thanjavur district, the ‘rice bowl’ of the Madras State [which was how the State was called then], has been experiencing very great difficulty for the last six weeks in meeting the local demands for rice and daily one can see long queues in every town and village in the district waiting for hours to get their daily quota.”

title: Advance compensation for rain-affected Kuruvai paddy farmers, T.N. Agri Minister urges insurance companies
content: According to a press release, the Minister chaired a review meeting at the Secretariat with officials and representatives from insurance companies.

title: When over 50 people perished in a bizarre fire accident on the Madras-Bangalore Highway
content: Within the minutes, flames consumed at least 49 people including women and children. It took two hours for eight fire tenders, from Kancheepuram, Tiruvallur and Madras to put out the blaze.

title: Foreign Minister of Cyprus to visit India
content: Official sources here highlighted that Cyprus has been one of the “most consistent” supporters of India on the Kashmir issue

title: CM Stalin asks Union Minister to ensure fertiliser supply
content: It is expected that the Samba paddy area will increase, in addition to cultivation of other crops like maize, blackgram, greengram, groundnut, and sugarcane, Mr. Stalin said

title: TNCDW offers mental health training for women SHGs
content: The TNCDW has been providing training to over 3.31 lakh women and students in about 16,500 schools and over 1,600 colleges.

title: SC orders NHRC to monitor Mental Health Authorities across the country
content: A petition had highlighted the plight of mentally-ill prisoners who were found chained at a “faith-based” asylum at Badayun in Uttar Pradesh

title: Why can't Bihar have Muslim CM, asks Owaisi
content: The Hyderabad MP lambasted the ruling NDA as well as the opposition INDIA bloc for allegedly "giving a raw deal" to the Muslim community

title: By declaring Tejashwi as CM face, INDIA bloc gave up little chance it had: Chirag
content: Mr. Paswan said the move has taken away even "a sliver of a chance" the opposition alliance had in the upcoming Bihar assembly elections.

title: Women indispensable for sustainable peace, says P. Wilson at UN Peacebuilding Commission
content: Mr. Wilson said India has shown through the deployment of women as peacekeepers that they can build trust in communities and “give hope to vulnerable populations”

title: A.P. is fully prepared for cyclone impact, says Minister Lokesh
content: The entire government machinery is functioning with 99% real-time accuracy in data and response to Cyclone Montha, he says

title: Trade talks with EU reduced ‘outstanding issues’, says Goyal
content: Foundation laid for balanced and robust agreement, says Minister after meeting with counterpart; high-level EU team to visit India next week

title: SIR is a BJP plot to select voters, says TMC’s Abhishek Banerjee
content: The Trinamool Congress general secretary asked why the SIR was being carried out only in West Bengal, and not in any State bordering Bangladesh and Myanmar

title: Missing minor girl killed in road accident
content: A 16-year-old girl who was reported missing after not returning from school in Bannerghatta, was later killed in a road accident on Hosakote Road

title: CM stresses round-the-clock monitoring as Cyclone Montha nears A.P. coast
content: Wind and rainfall intensity should be forecast in advance for a timely response, says Naidu, adding speed and efficiency must be ensured in relief and rehabilitation measures

title: Experts blame warmer sea for increasing frequency of tropical cyclones over Bay of Bengal
content: Since 2010, Andhra Pradesh has borne the brunt of at least 10 major tropical cyclones, some of them categorised as severe and very severe cyclonic storms

title: Watch: Challenges Faced by Paddy Farmers in Tamil Nadu
content: The Cauvery delta in central Tamil Nadu, regarded as the rice bowl of south India, is in the news, though for all the wrong reasons

title: As SIR expands, questions on Election Commission’s power to conduct exercise, verify citizenship still pending in Supreme Court
content: Petitioners challenging the Bihar SIR claim it violated voters rights, broke voting laws, wrongly requires existing voters to prove citizenship; Election Commission cites plenary powers granted under Article 324

title: Cyclone Montha crosses A.P. coast near Narsapur, heavy rain damages 43,000 hectares of crops
content: 83,000 farmers affected in Andhra Pradesh, power sector incurs loss of ₹2,200 crore with damage to infrastructure; 35,000 people evacuated

title: Will Vikassheel Insaan Party chief Mukesh Sahani enthuse EBCs to vote for the Mahagatbandhan?
content: The Mallah voters continue to remain divided between the NDA and the Mahagatbandhan; despite being in politics for 10 years, Mukesh Sahani is not very relatable to the people from his caste

title: CPI resolute in its stance on PM SHRI; CPI(M) to assuage hurt sentiments
content: CPI(M) is contemplating ways to restore the thaw in its relations with CPI in view of the upcoming local body elections.  The former may try to cool tempers by explaining the reasons for hurriedly joining the scheme. A meeting of LDF will be convened soon to give an explanation to the allies

title: Congress questions Centre’s plan to place Agniveers in private security firms
content: The party accuses government of betraying its promise to provide pensionable jobs to Agniveers in government services

title: Cyclone Montha: incessant rain wreaks havoc in Nellore, Prakasam districts
content: People from both the districts, particularly the daily wage labourers, face severe problems; continuous rains in the catchment areas and steady inflows from upstream led to rising water levels in Penna river and Somasila Reservoir in Nellore district

title: Opposition parties in West Bengal raise concern over ‘hurried’ SIR process
content: Opposition and regional parties warn marginalised voters, orphans and those who lost documents in floods, risk being excluded

title: MLA smells corruption in Speaker’s office, seeks HC judge-monitored probe into purchases of all materials
content: Speaker U.T. Khader denies corruption in his office. All materials were purchased legally with due approval from the Finance Department, he says

title: AICC issues ultimatum to KPCC to end factionalism and begin local body campaign
content: AICC summoned State leadership to Delhi for marathon closed-door discussions and one-to-ones with the national leadership

title: Agitation committee condemns govt. decision to set up PPP model college
content: Several leaders speak of what they think will be the potential dangers of such a move to set up the medical college in Vijayapura

title: Cyclone Montha disrupts pilgrim life in Tirumala
content: Devotees suffer a lot to reach Vaikuntam Complex amid heavy showers, and find it difficult to return to their cottages owing to the non-availability of private cabs and taxis

title: Parthiv Patel backs Artificial Intelligence sports-tech startup
content: Parthiv, who is the assistant coach of IPL franchise Gujarat Titans, thus joined angel investor Kunal Sinha in backing the Bengaluru-based startup

title: Saudi LCC flyadeal to enter India next year with 4-5 destinations
content: The network expansion comes at a time Saudi Arabia has unveiled Saudia 2030 Vision, an ambitious plan to diversify its economy beyond oil and create expanded opportunities for its citizens and position the country as a tourist hub

title: Heavy rains pound coastal mandals of Tirupati district
content: Gudur receives the highest rainfall of 63.6 mm by 6 p.m. on Tuesday, followed by Chillakur (47), Kota (46.4), Ozili (45) and Vakadu (44)

title: Relocation of forest dwellers from tiger reserves must be voluntary: Tribal Affairs Ministry
content: Shares policy with Environment Ministry, calling for a national framework, database, and annual audits of relocation projects, to check for human rights compliance, proper FRA implementation

title: GHMC eyes a bounty from mapping property tax records with electricity connections
content: As part of the exercise, PTINs were being mapped with the electricity service connections (USCs) of the Telangana Southern Power Distribution Company

title: Kerala’s start-up ecosystem grew by 254% during 2021-23 period: CM
content: The State ranks first in Asia in terms of affordable talent as per the Global Startup Ecosystem Report and earned the Top Performer status in the 2022 National Startup Rankings.

title: CM opens country’s first designer zoo and Asia’s second largest at Puthur
content: Built on 338 acres, the world-class Thrissur Zoological park redefines the idea of a zoo — from cages to coexistence. Designed by Australian architect Jon Coe, the park boasts nine zones that showcase diverse ecosystems.

title: Pilots slam move to dilute court order on restricted night flying to combat fatigue
content: As Air India and IndiGo secure DGCA exemptions from Delhi High Court‑mandated rest and duty limits, pilot group terms move “breach of law” and threatens contempt action

title: Firm on Naga political demands, says Muivah
content: If you don’t come to understand us, there is no point in our going to you, the NSCN (I-M) leader tells New Delhi from his birthplace, Somdal in Manipur

title: UAE Land Forces Commander’s visit focuses on expanding military cooperation, defence collaboration
content: Maj. Gen. Al Hallami holds discussions with General Upendra Dwivedi, Chief of Army Staff, on avenues to further deepen bilateral cooperation between the two Armies

title: BJP battles internal turmoil as it fights for third term in Palakkad
content: BJP remains confident that its 40,000-strong vote base in Palakkad municipality is intact.  Internal conflicts are rampant within both BJP and Congress. In 2020, UDF’s seat count dropped from 17 to 14 largely due to Congress’ internal discord.  LDF is likely to adopt a strategy of backing Independent candidates in certain wards

title: Pak Minister's Wild Claim As Islamabad Struggles With Kabul Peace Talks
content: Pakistan Defence Minister accused New Delhi of controlling Kabul and staging a proxy war against Islamabad.

title: Heat-Related Deaths Around The World Top Half A Million A Year: Study
content: Soaring temperatures are killing nearly 550,000 people around the world each year, part of a heat death toll that's climbed more than 20% on a population-adjusted basis since the 1990s, according to the latest edition of the Lancet's annual report on

title: Bike Taxi Driver Sexually Assaults Woman In Chennai, Then Drops Her Home
content: A man working as a bike taxi driver in Chennai was arrested by the police for sexually assaulting a 22-year-old woman on Monday.

title: Japan PM's Local Luxury Bag Costing $895 Is Viral, Sparks Orders
content: The handbag Takaichi often carries when walking into the PM's residence as the "Grace Delight Tote" made by Hamano Inc., a 145-year-old Japanese leather goods maker, whose products have long been favored by members of Japan's imperial family.

title: Lawrence Bishnoi Gang Kills Industrialist In Canada, Fires At Singers House
content: The notorious Lawrence Bishnoi gang continues to wreak havoc in Canada.The gang claimed responsibility for killing an Indian-origin British Columbia-based industrialist on Monday and firing at the house of a Punjabi singer.

title: Trump Calls Dementia Screening "Very Hard" IQ Test, Then Brags About Result
content: US President Donald Trump has claimed that he has taken an "IQ test," appearing to confuse it with a dementia screening test.

title: 64 Dead, 81 Arrested In Brazil During Raid On Rio de Janeiro Drug Gang
content: About 2,500 Brazilian police and soldiers launched a massive raid on a drug-trafficking gang in Rio de Janeiro on Tuesday, arresting 81 suspects and sparking shootouts that left at least 60 suspects and four police officers dead, officials said.

title: Pakistan's Lahore Becomes World's Most Polluted City: Report
content: Pakistan's Lahore city ranked as the world's most polluted city on Monday, the second such time in a week's time, with smog reaching hazardous levels way higher than WHO guidelines, a private tech company data showed.

title: US Senate Passes Legislation To Overturn Trump's Tariffs On Brazil
content: The Republican-led US Senate passedlegislation on Tuesday that would overturn President Donald Trump's tariffs against Brazil by terminating the national emergency he declared in July in retaliation for Brazil'sprosecution of Jair Bolsonaro.

title: "I Was In Guilt": Actor Vijay Breaks Down As He Meets Stampede Victims' Families
content: Actor and Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) Chief Vijay broke down on Monday as he met families of victims of the stampede that killed 41 people at his rally in Karur last month.

title: Rebel Groups' Capture Of Sudan's El-Fasher Sparks Fears Of Mass Killings
content: Fears mounted in Sudan on Tuesday, three days after paramilitaries seized the key city of El-Fasher, amid reports of mass atrocities and the killing of five Red Crescent volunteers in Kordofan.

title: President Droupadi Murmu To Fly Sortie In Rafale Fighter Jet Tomorrow
content: President Droupadi Murmu will take a sortie in a Rafale fighter jet from Ambala Air Force base in Haryana on Wednesday.

title: Gaza Says 30 Killed In Israeli Strikes On Netanyahu's Order
content: Gaza's civil defence agency said Israel carried out air strikes Tuesday despite an ongoing ceasefire, after accusing Hamas of attacking its troops and violating the US-brokered truce.

title: "Climate Crisis Won't Lead To Humanity's Demise": Bill Gates
content: Climate change "will not lead to humanity's demise," billionaire philanthropist Bill Gates has said in a long memo in which he argued that tackling global disease and poverty will help prepare the planet's poorest for a warming world.

title: Indian Man Stabs Two Teens With Metal Fork On US-Germany Flight, Arrested
content: An Indian national, Praneeth Kumar Usiripalli, has been charged in the US with allegedly stabbing two teenagers with a metal fork and slapping a passenger on board a Lufthansa flight.

title: India Saw 20 Heatwave Days In 2024, Most Linked To Climate Change: Report
content: People in India each experienced nearly 20 heatwave days in 2024 on average, of which about six-and-a-half days would not be expected were it not for climate change, according to a new global report published by The Lancet journal.

title: Centre Asks States To Ensure Ex-Agniveers Hired By Private Security Firms
content: The Centre has asked all states and Union territories to ensure the recruitment of ex-Agniveers into private security agencies and training institutes as they have experience working in the armed forces, officials said on Tuesday.

title: Trump's Truth Social To Allow Betting On Elections, Interest Rates, Sports
content: The social media network founded by US President Donald Trump, Truth Social, announced Tuesday that it will allow users to make bets on the outcome of real-world events using the platform.

title: Category 5 Hurricane Melissa Brings Flooding, Catastrophic Winds To Jamaica
content: Heavy floodwaters swept across southwestern Jamaica, winds tore roofs off buildings and boulders tumbled onto roads Tuesday as Hurricane Melissa came ashore as a catastrophic Category 5 storm, one of the strongest Atlantic hurricanes on record.

title: "Horrified": UN Slams Brazil After 64 Killed In Rio de Janeiro Drug Raids
content: The UN human rights office said Tuesday it was "horrified" by police raids on drug traffickers in Rio de Janeiro that left at least 64 dead, calling for swift investigations.

title: No artificial rain after cloud seeding: Why Delhi’s Rs 3.2 crore experiment fell flat
content: Delhi's attempt at tackling air pollution through cloud seeding has sparked criticism from environmental specialists who view this strategy as nothing more than a costly band-aid.

title: BJP neta arrested for crushing farmer to death, harassing his family
content: BJP functionary Mahendra Nagar has been arrested as the main accused in the murder of farmer Ramswaroop Dhakad. Dhakad was attacked by armed men and run over by a vehicle following a land dispute. Nagar is also accused of molesting the victim's daughter during the incident.

title: Shreyas Iyer injury latest: How and why docs rushed him to hospital
content: India's vice-captain Shreyas Iyer suffered a life-threatening spleen laceration and internal bleeding during a third ODI against Australia in Sydney. Swift medical intervention at St. Vincent's Hospital in Sydney arrested the bleeding without surgery. Iyer is now stable and recovering well, with teammates and the BCCI confirming his improving condition.

title: Cyclone Montha: Andhra, Odisha battered; 1 dead, thousands evacuated
content: Cyclone Montha made landfall on India's eastern coast, bringing fierce winds and heavy rain to Andhra Pradesh and Odisha. The severe storm caused damage, including snapped power lines and flooded homes, with one fatality reported in Andhra Pradesh. Authorities initiated extensive evacuations and deployed rescue teams to aid affected populations.

title: Microsoft, OpenAI renew pact: End biggest 'contract note'; ease internal tensions
content: OpenAI has restructured into a public benefit corporation, solidifying CEO Sam Altman's authority and enabling significant growth through a major deal with Microsoft. This agreement untangles capital-raising limitations from their 2019 partnership, with Microsoft securing a $250 billion cloud computing contract and a 27% stake in the new PBC.

title: Israel launches ‘powerful strikes’ on Gaza; over 30 killed
content: Fresh Israeli airstrikes in Gaza have killed at least 30 people and wounded dozens, despite an ongoing US-brokered ceasefire. The Israeli military stated the strikes were a response to Hamas attacking its troops, a claim Hamas denies. The renewed violence strains the ceasefire amid disputes over the return of hostage remains.

title: A drop catch and a duck: Babar Azam's forgettable T20I comeback - Watch
content: Babar Azam's return to T20 internationals ended in disappointment as Pakistan suffered a 55-run defeat against South Africa. Azam was dismissed for a duck on his comeback, and a dropped catch by him proved costly. South Africa posted 194, with Pakistan faltering in their chase, managing only 139.

title: Gunfire at Punjabi singer Channi Nattan’s Canada home: Bishnoi gang claims responsibility
content: The Lawrence Bishnoi gang claimed responsibility for a shooting at Punjabi singer Channi Nattan's Canada residence, citing his alleged ties with Saradar Khera. A gang aide released a video, warning other singers against associating with Khera. Local authorities are investigating the claim.

title: Layoffs at Amazon: Managers receive email; HR division faces deepest cuts
content: Amazon initiated urgent manager training on October 27, preceding notifications to up to 30,000 corporate employees about layoffs starting the next day. These cuts, impacting nearly 10% of its corporate workforce across various divisions, represent the company's largest job reduction. The move comes amid aggressive cost-cutting and significant AI investments, with a strict return-to-office policy failing to reduce staff voluntarily.

title: US-China ties: Trump hopes to ‘solve a lot of problems’ with Xi - Taiwan maybe be off agenda
content: US President Donald Trump anticipates significant progress in his upcoming talks with Chinese leader Xi Jinping, expecting many issues to be resolved.  He indicated that the sensitive topic of Taiwan might not even be discussed, stating, "Taiwan is Taiwan." Trump also expressed optimism about lowering fentanyl tariffs, believing China will cooperate on the drug crisis.

title: Smoke over Rio de Janeiro: Anti-gang raid leaves 64 dead, including four cops — video
content: A massive police operation targeting the Comando Vermelho gang in Rio de Janeiro resulted in at least 64 deaths, including four officers, marking the deadliest raid in the city's history. The operation, involving 2,500 security personnel, occurred days before Rio hosts major global climate events.

title: ‘Tough timing’: GM axes 200 salaried staff; layoffs hit days after profit surge
content: General Motors has let go of over 200 salaried employees, mainly CAD engineers, at its Michigan tech campus. This move, part of a restructuring to boost profits, follows strong third-quarter earnings and a raised financial outlook. GM stated the layoffs target execution roles to enhance core design capabilities. This comes as the automotive sector sees broader workforce reductions.

title: Yuvraj Singh reveals he suggested ‘divorce’ to his parents amid constant fights
content: Cricketer Yuvraj Singh revealed he urged his parents to separate at age 14-15 due to constant fighting, which he felt was detrimental to the family. He expressed deep gratitude for his mother's sacrifices in raising him after the divorce. Yuvraj's relationship with his father, actor Yograj Singh, has remained strained over the years.

title: 'Hard work paying off': Shami sends selectors a fiery reminder
content: Senior pacer Mohammed Shami has reaffirmed his readiness for an India comeback after a stellar performance in the Ranji Trophy. Following ankle surgery, Shami delivered a fiery spell, taking eight wickets to lead Bengal to victory. He expressed his commitment to staying fit and performing, leaving the decision to selectors.

title: North Korea fires cruise missiles ahead of Donald Trump-Xi Jinping meeting in South Korea
content: North Korea launched sea-to-surface cruise missiles into western waters, a move that could bolster its nuclear-armed military. This occurred just before US President Trump's arrival in South Korea for talks. Pyongyang has shunned negotiations with Washington and Seoul since 2019, with leader Kim Jong Un now prioritizing Russia and opposing denuclearization demands.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Anand Rathi's Mehul Kothari recommends Tata Steel, Jai Corp, and Vadilal Industries for investment. Tata Steel shows an all-time high breakout, Jai Corp a cup-and-handle breakout, and Vadilal Industries a trend reversal from a rising trendline, all indicating strong bullish momentum.

title: Sandalwood oil may help prevent skin cancer and boost skin health
content: Sandalwood oil, rich in alpha-santalol, offers promising benefits for skin health. Scientific studies reveal its potential to combat skin cancer by reducing tumor growth and halting abnormal cell multiplication. The oil's anti-inflammatory and antioxidant qualities protect skin from damage. Experts suggest incorporating quality sandalwood oil into skincare routines alongside sun protection for healthier, resilient skin.

title: 'No communication': From Shami to Rahane - Players not afraid to call out selectors
content: Senior Indian cricketers like Mohammed Shami, Ajinkya Rahane, and Karun Nair are publicly expressing frustration over selection policies and communication gaps under Ajit Agarkar's committee. Concerns about transparency and age bias have surfaced, with players questioning their exclusion despite strong domestic performances. This highlights a growing disconnect between experienced players and the selection panel's approach.

title: How much tax does Shohei Ohtani pay? Inside Dodgers contract and savings
content: Shohei Ohtani's massive $700 million Dodgers deal is a masterclass in tax savings. By deferring most of his salary, Ohtani is paying significantly less in taxes annually. Experts predict he could save an additional $90 million by relocating to a state with no income tax before receiving his deferred payments, all while continuing his stellar on-field performance.

title: 'It's time to move forward' - PSL team owner calls for truce with PCB
content: Multan Sultans owner Ali Khan Tareen has extended an olive branch to the PCB, proposing four reforms for better PSL management after a public dispute. Tareen, who previously tore up a legal notice from the board, now seeks a "fresh relationship" built on transparency and trust. This move follows a heated exchange over critical remarks about PSL governance.

title: Shreyas Iyer update: Near-fatal injury to ICU exit — how the Sydney scare unfolded
content: Indian cricketer Shreyas Iyer is stable after a serious on-field injury in Sydney, which caused internal bleeding and required ICU care. Doctors successfully arrested the bleeding through a medical procedure, and Iyer is now recovering well, out of the ICU, and eating normally. His recovery is progressing faster than anticipated.

title: Avocado vs Amla: Indians compromising health by ditching modern wisdom for fancy plates?
content: Indian kitchens are rediscovering the humble amla, a potent superfood often overlooked for trendy imports like avocado. Rich in Vitamin C, amla offers superior immunity, heart health, and metabolic benefits at a fraction of the cost. This ancient fruit, deeply rooted in Ayurveda, provides unparalleled nutritional value and sustainability, making it a wise choice for modern wellness.

title: Drama in Pak cricket: Rizwan revolts after shock demotion; refuses to sign central contract
content: Mohammad Rizwan has refused to sign Pakistan's new central contract after being demoted to Category B. He is reportedly seeking the reinstatement of Category A for senior players and clearer tenures for captains. Rizwan's concerns stem from his recent removal as ODI captain.

title: Bihar polls: 32% candidates in Phase-I face criminal charges - ADR report
content: A new report by ADR and Bihar Election Watch reveals that 32% of candidates in Bihar's first phase assembly elections have declared criminal cases, with 27% facing serious charges. Wealth also plays a significant role, as 40% of analyzed candidates are crorepatis, with RJD and BJP showing the highest percentages.

title: Influencer Ben Bader Found Unresponsive at Florida Home: What Happened
content: TikTok sensation Ben Bader, 25, was found unresponsive at his Florida home and tragically passed away despite resuscitation efforts. Authorities are investigating the cause of his sudden death, with all possibilities, including health issues or foul play, not ruled out. His girlfriend and family remember him as a kind, positive individual whose legacy will inspire many.

title: Driven to suicide by AI? Man writes to UP CM after son's death; seeks FIR
content: A Lucknow family alleges an AI chatbot pushed their 22-year-old son to suicide, claiming the tool offered methods and emotional support for ending his life. The youth, battling depression, was found dead with head injuries. His father seeks an FIR against the AI company for abetment, though police initially registered it as an accident.

title: Ryan Kesler misconduct case: Wife Andrea Kesler stands by ex-NHL star amid scandal
content: Former NHL center Ryan Kesler faces two counts of fourth-degree criminal sexual conduct in Michigan following a January 1 incident. Police investigated for nearly 10 months before filing charges against the 41-year-old, who pleaded not guilty and was released on bond. His wife, Andrea Kesler, is reportedly standing by him amid the legal scrutiny.

title: Brittany Mahomes stuns in fire-red at Chiefs MNF, steals Patrick’s spotlight
content: Brittany Mahomes is making a significant impact this NFL season, both with her bold fashion choices and her community involvement.  She recently wowed fans with a striking fire-red leather outfit, showcasing her growing influence beyond her husband Patrick's football career.  Together, the couple continues to give back to Kansas City through their foundation and sports team ownership.

title: Ex-SC State Player Robert Geathers Wins $18M Lawsuit Against NCAA
content: A South Carolina jury awarded $18 million to former South Carolina State player Robert Geathers and his wife, finding the NCAA negligent for failing to warn players about the long-term risks of concussions. Geathers, diagnosed with dementia and showing symptoms of CTE, played from 1977-1980. Attorneys argued the NCAA withheld crucial information about concussion dangers.

title: Clippers vs Warriors injury report: Who’s playing, who’s out?
content: The Golden State Warriors and Los Angeles Clippers face off on October 28, 2025, with both teams battling significant injury concerns. The Clippers are without Bradley Beal, Kobe Sanders, and Jordan Miller, placing more pressure on Harden and Leonard. The Warriors will miss Alex Toohey and De'Anthony Melton, while Al Horford is day-to-day.

title: Another blow to Maoists: 2 more top leaders surrender in Telangana; DGP credits CM Reddy
content: Two prominent CPI (Maoist) leaders, central committee member Pulluri Prasad Rao alias Chandranna and Telangana state committee member Bandi Prakash alias Prabhath, have joined the mainstream. Citing deteriorating health, ideological divisions, and security pressure, they surrendered without arms, receiving rehabilitation packages. Chandranna, however, rejected the term 'surrender' and vowed to continue advocating for Maoist ideology among the people.

title: ‘Immediate, powerful strikes’: Netanyahu orders Gaza offensive; cites Hamas truce breach
content: Following alleged repeated ceasefire violations by Hamas, including the return of hostages' bodies, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has ordered the IDF to launch immediate and powerful strikes in the Gaza Strip. This directive came after a security meeting and an attack on Israeli forces in southern Gaza, signaling a significant escalation.

title: '40 million tourists in 2 years': J&K CM hails record footfall; calls it 'unprecedented'
content: Jammu and Kashmir witnessed an unprecedented surge in tourism, with over 40 million visitors in the past two years. The region has become a prime film-shooting destination and is actively promoting offbeat locations. Significant funds were allocated for tourism promotion, with initiatives underway to boost winter tourism.

title: Unlikely alliance: NC, BJP join hands in J&K House; defeat PDP's 'anti-bulldozer' land bill
content: J&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah's National Conference and BJP united to reject the PDP's "anti-bulldozer bill," which aimed to grant ownership rights for illegal properties on state land. Abdullah argued the bill would legitimize encroachment, while PDP accused him of reneging on promises and siding with the BJP.

title: New satellite: Isro to give Navy big boost in sea communication; launch on Nov 2
content: 'Rukmini' has enabled secure real-time links between warships, submarines, aircraft and shore-based command centres across the Indian Ocean . with upgraded payloads, Gsat-7R or CMS-03 is designed to expand secure multi-band communications for the Navy’s growing blue-water operations .

title: Lowest in four years: Indian detentions on US border drop 62%; over 34k held in FY25
content: 34,146 Indian nationals intercepted between Oct '24 and Sept '25 . this is the sharpest drop over the past four years in the number of Indians caught trying to enter the US illegally . in FY22, Indians accounted for 63,927 interceptions, the latest data is 47% lower .

title: 'Amar Shonar Bangla': Assam Cong leader under fire for singing B’desh anthem; row erupts
content: He is a seasoned journalist with The Times of India, reporting from Silchar. His work reflects a commitment to factual reporting and amplifying voices from Assam’s southern frontier. Read More

title: 'Chinese behind most crypto, loan app rip-offs': ED report nails fraudsters; probe initiated
content: a report by enforcement directorate shows that a number of cybercrime victims have been targeted . the agency has already initiated a probe in many of these cases involving Chinese fraudsters . an estimated Rs 28,000 crore in crime proceeds has been identified . thousands of people were tricked across more than 20 states .

title: How to tackle misinformation? Govt trains top babus; holds day-long conference
content:
Representational image

NEW DELHI: To help bureaucrats issue quick and sharp responses to fight misinformation, the govt is sensitising its secretaries, joint secretaries, additional secretaries and directors on the use of new age media, including social media and podcasts, to put out facts coupled with information and status of schemes. TOI has learnt that a day-long conference was held for all secretary-level officers last week. Top bureaucrats, including the principal secretaries to the PM - P K Mishra and Shaktikanta Das - and cabinet secretary T V Somantahan, gave detailed presentations. Later this week, a similar programme will be held for additional and joint secretaries, while directors will be sensitised next week. "There is serious thinking on roping in influencers and artistes as they could have more impact than traditional govt communication," said an official, adding that plans are afoot to set up rapid response units within ministries.

End of Article

title: 'When we were at our lowest, the man didn't blink': What Cade Cunningham is building in Detroit

title: Takeaways: Blue Jays tie series with huge Game 4 win
content: the Toronto Blue Jays beat the los Angeles Dodgers 6-2 in game 4 to tie the series 2-2 . a two-run shot gave his team the lead in the third inning . the series goes back to Toronto for game 6 .

title: Questions about UConn's repeat chances, Stanford's comeback, more
content: the UConn Huskies won their fourth consecutive NCAA women's basketball title (11th overall) in 2016 . last season, they dominated Final Four foes UCLA and South Carolina . the team is ranked no. 1 in the preseason poll despite losing standout Paige Bueckers .

title: United Center's mozzarella pucks lead latest NHL, NBA arena food
content: The 2025-26 NBA and NHL seasons are underway, which means fans are filing into arenas again and concession stands will be getting creative to serve the masses. Among those creations are the crispy mozzarella pucks that will be sold only at  Chicago Blackhawks ' games at the United Center. The parmesan herb-breaded mozzarella sticks -- or in this case pucks -- are sold with homemade marinara sauce. Here are some other innovations that can be found at NBA and NHL arenas across the campaigns.
